N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 124.10 - Request for a rescheduled hearing

State Regulations
(a) Telephone. The motorist may request the
first rescheduled hearing date by telephone at least one day before the hearing
date by calling the telephone number listed on the traffic summons issued to
such motorist. (b) By mail. The
motorist may request the first reschedule hearing date by mailing his or her
request to the Traffic Violations Bureau Plea Unit, P.O. Box 2950-ESP, Albany, NY 12220-0950 at least 10 days before the scheduled hearing date. Any mail
transaction will be considered timely if postmarked at least 10 days prior to
the scheduled hearing date. The motorist will be notified by mail of the
rescheduled hearing date. (c) In
person. (1)

Prior to the date of hearing. (i) The motorist may request a first or
second rescheduled hearing date by appearing in person, or through a
representative appearing in person, at least one day before the scheduled
hearing date, at any hearing office; provided, however, if the request is for a
second rescheduled hearing date, the administrative law judge shall only grant
the rescheduled hearing for good cause shown. (ii)

For a third or subsequent request for a
rescheduled hearing date, the motorist or his or her representative must appear
at the hearing office where the hearing is scheduled to be held. The
administrative law judge shall only grant the rescheduled hearing for good
cause shown. (2)

On the
date of hearing. When a motorist or his or her representative wishes to
reschedule a hearing on the date of the scheduled hearing, the motorist or his
or her representative must make such request before an administrative law judge
at the hearing office where the hearing will be held; provided however, should
the motorist or his or her representative appear on the date of the hearing at
a hearing office other than the office at which the hearing is scheduled to be
held, a senior administrative law judge may, in his or her discretion, grant a
rescheduled hearing. All requests for a rescheduled hearing made on the date of
the hearing shall only be granted for good cause shown. Notes
